comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
I hoped this was the same gun as in a Phillips Collection (PhM) photo, but it isn't. 

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/3283283663/]

Gun expert required!

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Not the same gun but a great comparison nonetheless. What interesting contraptions...
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 38293973@N08
comment._content: I doubt that this gun was at Middle Head, as the Middle Head guns are quie well docume ted. More likely to be at South Head. See www.panoramio.com/photo_explorer#view=photo&position=... note that the way the gun is now mounted at South Head the carriage is back to front.

comment.author: 38293973@N08
comment._content: Other possibility: this gun is a 9in 12 ton RML at Georges Heights (Not 'Middle Head')

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/dougthebear] Thanks for your suggestions Doug, working out the location of the guns in thsi album is certainly a challenge.
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/dougthebear] The inscriptions under the photos in this Edward Hungerford album are more than usually accurate and contemporary, and in the same album there is a photo of a "Gun at George's Head" -

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons/8721378457/in/set-72157633437562473]

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Excellent 1877 interactive map showing the positions of the various gun emplacements (obviously does not show later alterations) - www.nla.gov.au/apps/cdview/?pi=nla.map-rm1400-sd&rgn=...

comment.author: 98444826@N04
comment._content:
The large gun above "Gun expert required" is one of two 10 inch 25 ton rifle muzzle loading guns mounted in Sydney at Middle Head, Not too successful, more details can be sourced from book "The Fragile Forts" by Peter Oppenheim.
ISBN 1-876439-34-3  Geoff. Largest gun mounted in NSW.
